Text: Contact ListThis may not be the most uptodate version of the Fuel Cell Team Contact List but its a start It needs to be updated anyway Take care Stephen

Contact List Silveroakan updated contact list for the fuel cell project Stephen Forwarded by Stephen PlaucheCorpEnron on PM Claudette CT PM To Stephen nron cc Subject Contact List Silveroak per your request claude

ENSR Extension LetterJoe Curreri at ENSR wanted me to let you know that he is still waiting on the signed extension letter Master Services Agreement Once you initial it please have someone deliver it to Janet Dietrich as she then needs to sign it before sending it back to Joe at ENSR Please let me know if there is anything I need to do to get this process completed Thanks Stephen x

Comments on Cc I would like to see all of the original spare parts language added back in Engineers are very wary of not having firm spare parts language and information from the OEMs B Virgo will not sign off on the deal until he is satisfied with the cost procurement and amount issues for spares What about keeping the current language from h as well Dont understand the concept of an offset in Explain to me tomorrow please FYI when I talked to Tony Leo this morning it is his understanding that the MW standards would not even apply in this PO I found that to be interesting as I told him the plan from ENAs standpoint was to build out the BOP and pursue the permitting for a MW plant We definitely need the unitbyunit language in this section It provides much more clarity than commercially reasonable does Stephen Kay Mann PM To Scott CT Stephen nron cc Subject down left but it is going faster

Comments and Issues Lists Cc Chris and Herb I have attached two documents for your convenience The first document is ENAs list of comments on the Purchase Order Agreement The second document is a commercial issues list which needs attention Please review both of these documents as ENA would like to discuss and review the information contained in these documents during tomorrows conference call starting at am EST Take care Regards Stephen Plauche Enron North America

Other Items Cc got this from Tony Leo Forwarded by Stephen PlaucheCorpEnron on PM Leo Tony on PM To Bentley Chris Nock Herb CEcom Leitman Jerry Levine Ross Jacqueline Scheib cc Subject RE Other Items Revised test protocol which is now referred to as Exhibit D in the contract While I am not showing the redlines I had changetracking on during my edit so you can see them by clicking the other two checkboxes in the Track Changes menu Note also that I am proposing that another definition be added to the test Performance Test Procedures The definition would read something like Performance Test Procedures shall mean detailed test procedures developed based on the Acceptance and Performance Evaluation Testing Protocol Exhibit D which have been mutually agreed upon by Purchaser and Seller Tony Acceptance and Performance Test Fuel Cells doc Original Message From SMTP Sent Thursday November PM To Leo Tony Cc Subject Other Items Tony In regards to FCEs test procedures and performance evaluation guidelines can you provide ENA with the following items if you havent already done so clearly define the differences between base load and max guarantee output please review and provide ENA with the items for which plant performance shall be corrected as well as the correction factors for each item confirm inclusion of items originally bracketed in list of auxiliaries to be accounted for Regards Stephen Acceptance and Performance Test Fuel Cells doc

Exhibit Cexhibit C for the PO Stephen Forwarded by Stephen PlaucheCorpEnron on AM Leo Tony on PM To Bentley Chris Nock Herb CEcom Leitman Jerry Levine Ross Jacqueline Scheib cc Subject Exhibit C Exhibit C of the contract Fixed Specifications is attached along with the figure attachment Let me know if anyone wants to retitle the figure or rework any of the language Tony Exhibit Cdoc Attachment to Exhibit Ctif Exhibit Cdoc Attachment to Exhibit Ctif

Fuel Cell Purcahse agreementStephen Forwarded by Stephen PlaucheCorpEnron on AM From David Marshall ECT PM To Stephen nron cc Subject Fuel Cell Purcahse agreement Steve my comments attached and in red when viewed onscreen
Scope of supplyHere is the most recent scope of work document bw FCE and ENA Thanks Stephen x

Additional Comments Cc Here are my comments in regards to CRRAs technical questions FYI Exhibit A is simply going to be a photocopy of FCEs expected degradation curves Exhibit B is going to be a photocopy of FCEs expected water quality points The plan is to have ENA make comments and then send to Tony Leo for his sign off and approval Mike Could you please review my comments and let me know if any changes additions need to be made Kay Could you please let me know how many cycles it takes before FCEs warranty expires please regard question Stephen x

New Exhibit CSP Forwarded by Stephen PlaucheCorpEnron on PM Leo Tony on AM To cc Levine Ross Skok Andy Bentley Chris Nock Herb CEcom Subject FW New Exhibit C Here is the latest version of exhibit C the fixed spec which now includes the correction factor discussion I assumed that this was sent with the contract draft that Jackie sent to Kay later that day but it apparently wasnt Note that the message refers to a new draft of the test protocol which is the one I sent out on Original Message From Leo Tony Sent Sunday November PM To Levine Ross Cc Scheib Jacqueline Pennino Bentley Chris Nock Herb Leitman Jerry Subject New Exhibit C Joe Debs and I had a conference call with the Enron tech folks Thursday night to discuss their comments on our Test Protocol We agreed to some changes which I will issue a draft of early this week During the call they pointed out that the protocol refered to Performance Correction factors but that we had never established the Basis Points which those correction factors are meant to adjust to In other words the contract needs a place where we state that performance is based on operation at sea level degress etc We all agreed that the fixed spec Exhibit C was a good place to put this I went ahead and did that and it also occurred to me that this is also where our performance correction statements could go So the attached file is a new Exhibit C incorporating the site and basis conditions the correction factors and Enrons comments on the old short Exhibit C delete the word prefered in the Stack Height section and delete the word attached in the reference to the interface drawing Exhibit C Fixed Specsdoc Exhibit C Fixed Specsdoc

Preliminary Spec with Spare PartsSP Forwarded by Stephen PlaucheCorpEnron on PM Leo Tony on AM To Leo Tony cc Levine Ross Skok Andy Bentley Chris Nock Herb CEcom Jacqueline Scheib Subject Preliminary Spec with Spare Parts Attached file is a new version of the preliminary spec with added language on initial spare parts Preliminary Specification with Sparesdoc

Test Protocol RewriteTerri Austin tells me that none of her testing protocol engineers had any additional comments on this one SP Forwarded by Stephen PlaucheCorpEnron on PM Leo Tony on AM To cc Debs Joseph Nock Herb CEcom Bentley Chris Levine Ross Subject Test Protocol Rewrite All Attached is a rewrite of the acceptance test protocol incorporating changes made in last Thursdays conference call with Joe Debs me Scott Terri Stephen et al Tony Acceptance and Performance Test Fuel Cells doc Anthony Leo Director Product Engineering FuelCell Energy Inc This transmittal and its attached files if any may contain proprietary or confidential information belonging to FuelCell Energy Inc If you are not the intended recipient you are hereby notified that you have received this transmittal in error Any review disclosure use dissemination distribution or copying of this information is strictly prohibited If you suspect that you have received this communication in error please notify us immediately by telephone at or email at and immediately delete this message and all its attachments Acceptance and Performance Test Fuel Cells doc

LOI and Development Agreement re CRRAStephen Forwarded by Stephen PlaucheCorpEnron on PM From Lisa Zarsky ECT PM To Stephen nron cc Subject LOI and Development Agreement re CRRA Forwarded by Lisa ZarskyHOUECT on PM Brenda Whitehead AM To Scott CT cc Barton CT Subject LOI and Development Agreement re CRRA per the request of Bart Clark please see these attachments

Firm Transport Contracts and available storage space Cc PST Tom and Hunter I am an Associate working in Don Millers ENA estate management group British Petroleum has inquired about Enrons existing Firm NG Transport Contracts and available storage contracts They specifically listed these types of assets as ones that BP would be interested in looking at buying from Enron Can the two of you get back to either Stuart or myself with respect to what is available and some indication of pricing for these assets Thanks Regards Stephen Plauche Associate Enron North America
Pitch Bookyou go This is sans Calumet and Torrence sites because Peoples Energy owns those sites Stephen x

Map Cc Can we move the of the US slide to the middle of the page and title the slide Enron East Origination Development Sites Please send to Ben Jacoby once complete Thanks again for your assistance Stephen x Forwarded by Stephen PlaucheCorpEnron on AM Benjamin CT AM To Stephen NRON cc Subject Re Map

Map Cc In regards to the Chicago area we also need to add another dot to the map for the Pontiac site This site will be labeled differently from the Plano and Torrance sites The Pontiac site will be labeled Development Site under Negotiation Thanks Stephen

MapAs far as Georgia is concerned we should have a total of five dots on the state The Doyle project actually needs to be changed to In Operation as it is now going through its run tests The Athens GA site should be labeled Development Site Secured Then their should be three other dots all labeled for Development Site Under Construction These three dots are sites in Hart Jefferson and Washington county GA Stephen Benjamin CT AM To Stephen nron cc Subject Here are the maps for the development sites Ben

Take me out to the I find that you have a midly attractive sense of humor and a cynical side to you that separates you from the rest of the tribe Its funny you mentioned the Astros game I was actually thinking of inviting you since I have two tickets to tonights game and all but you have turned me down so many times in the past I decided to go with a more conservative pick Anyhow since I absolutely detest Woodys and all of my bold suggestions for other venues consistently gets dissed by the groups brain trust please take me off of this distribution list Have a nice day Steve Susan M CT PM To Timothy ES Robert NortonENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT Benjamin NRON Lisa CT Kyle CT Victor CT Daniel NRON Shanna nron Yvette NRON Christopher nron Stephen nron Dan FeatherEnron NRONDEVELOPMENT Eric CT Nick CT Chad CT Matthew CT Misti CT Benjamin CT Carrie CT Christa CT Brian CT Bryan CT Heather CT Sheetal CT Hang CT Kreg CT Michael CT Mason CT Jennifer CT Tobin CT Alicia CT Nicholas J CT Lisa CT Kyle CT Victor CT Sunil NRON Wilson NRON cc Subject Take me out to the Oh wait I cant go to the ball game because I couldnt take a day off from work to stand in the Enron lobby or send my secretary to do it for me For all of you who have managed to snag tickets for tonights game congratulations and you suck For the rest of us stuck out in the cold I suggest the only viable alternative before us is to drown our sorrows in a cold bottle of beer or two or three I realize the mass email has been MIA the last two weeks For some this may have been a welcomed relief For others there may have been some concern that they had been cutoff from the distribution At present no one has been removed from the distribution but it is undergoing an audit Should it be determined that it is necessary to remove an individual from the list for any reason that individual will be notified and given an explanation If anyone would like to know the causes for expulsion you can write to I CANT BELIEVE ANYONE CARES IF THERE ON THIS DISTRIBUTION OR NOT BECAUSE THE ONLY PLACE WE SEEM TO GO IS WOODYS EVERY THURSDAY BETWEEN AND On that note see you guys at Woodys tonight around or

REPST just spoke to Cathy Moehlman in Treasury she said that she ahs the K payment still doesnt have the K payment she is going to check with AP right now let you know when I hear SP Original Message From Carson Mike Sent Friday January AM To Sewell Doug Plauche Stephen Confer Mark Cc Miller Don Asset Mktg Gorte David Subject There is NO Tuesday markets available today We can not wire cash on Monday due to the holiday So Koch will allow us to make to them an estimate payment aprox We will cover the postions on Monday The difference in actual will be netted out of Tuedays payment Michael Carson
